thread.title: BMC Election Results 2017: Congress leader Milind Deora mocks Mumbaikars for choosing Shiv Sena, BJP - The Financial Express
thread.title_full: BMC Election Results 2017: Congress leader Milind Deora mocks Mumbaikars for choosing Shiv Sena, BJP - The Financial Express

author: Fe Online
title: BMC Election Results 2017: Congress leader Milind Deora mocks Mumbaikars for choosing Shiv Sena, BJP - The Financial Express
text:
BMC Election Results 2017: Congress leader Milind Deora mocks Mumbaikars for choosing Shiv Sena, BJP BMC Election Results 2017: Congress leader Milind Deora mocks Mumbaikars for choosing Shiv Sena, BJP In an unprecedented attack on citizens of Mumbai over the results, former IT and Telecom minister said, "Conclusion one can draw from BMC election results is that Mumbaikars seem content living with potholes, flooding, malaria & water tankers." By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: February 23, 2017 2:22 PM In an unprecedented attack on citizens of Mumbai over the results, former IT and Telecom minister said, “Conclusion one can draw from BMC election results is that Mumbaikars seem content living with potholes, flooding, malaria & water tankers.” 
Senior Congress leader and former Union Minister Milind Deora today accepted defeat in Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, saying “Congrats Shiv Sena & BJP for retaining BMC.” In a veiled attack at Shiv Sena and BJP, he also said, “For Mumbai’s sake, earnestly hope the next 5 years are better than the last 2 decades.” In an unprecedented attack on citizens of Mumbai over the results, former IT and Telecom minister said, “Conclusion one can draw from BMC election results is that Mumbaikars seem content living with potholes, flooding, malaria & water tankers.” 
The Shiv Sena is maintaining its hold on Mumbai, leading on 93 seats followed by BJP on 68 seats as trends of counting of votes in Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, where the saffron allies are locked in a battle, poured in. 
Check out Milind Deora’s tweet Congrats Shiv Sena & BJP for retaining BMC. For Mumbai’s sake, earnestly hope the next 5 years are better than the last 2 decades 
— Milind Deora (@milinddeora) February 23, 2017 Conclusion one can draw from BMC election results is that Mumbaikars seem content living with potholes, flooding, malaria & water tankers 
— Milind Deora (@milinddeora) February 23, 2017 
The Congress and the NCP are far behind the Sena and the BJP, leading on 5 and 2 seats, respectively, in the 227-member BMC. 
As per trends coming in from the other city corporations, zilla parishads and panchayat samitis, the BJP is ahead of its rivals on 18 seats and Shiv Sena on 7 seats in the Nashik civic body. 
Watch this video 
The ruling MNS in Nashik, Congress and NCP were leading on 2 seats each. 
The civic polls, especially in the country’s financial hub Mumbai, have generated much political heat on account of the fierce fight between the BJP and the Sena, despite being partners in governments in the state and at the Centre. 
The battle of the estranged allies has put a question mark on the stability of the BJP-led ministry in the state as Sena had been tenacious in its attack on the senior partner and the Centre’s demonetisation policy. 
The results will determine the fate of 21,620 candidates for 5,777 seats up for grabs in the 10 municipal corporations, 25 zilla parishads and 283 panchayat samitis for which the elections were held in two phases. 
The stakes are high for Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray , who led their respective parties from the front and were involved in a high decibel and no-holds-barred campaign, relegating the opposition Congress, NCP and other players like the MNS and the AIMIM to the background.
